result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas Jackson Graves Jr

records.addlTxt: to Ct from Atty Ryder re;  conflict w/county apptmt

2:14 PM Defendant Thomas Jackson Graves Jr in court.  Attorney Kenneth W. Ryder III appeared by video for Thomas Jackson Graves Jr.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22CF75, 22CF106, and 22CM178.  22CF75 here for post arraignment STC.  22CF106 here for post arraignment STC.  22CF178 here for initial appearance, Atty Ryder is not appointed in that case.  Atty briefly talked with def about has not seen complaint, if no conflict will take case.  21CF14, 21CF17, and 21CF165 were in court earlier, waiting for representation to vacate DEJ.  Atty to look at these cases as well and see if he can represent those as well and than he will have all 6 cases.  MH for 11/28 to stay on.  22CF178 will be initial all other STC.  Atty is appointed in case 22CF178, 21CF17, 21CF14, and 21CF165.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on November 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Email sent to ACJ advising def has court on Oct 31;  ka
Cases 22CF75 and 22CF106

3:05 PM Defendant Thomas Jackson Graves Jr appeared by video, in custody from ACJ.  Attorney Kenneth W. Ryder III appeared by video for Thomas Jackson Graves Jr.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22CF75 and 22CF106.  Atty, def waives right to prelim hearing in both cases.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts waiver.  Court finds PC the def committed a felony in Ashland County and bound over for arraignment.  State is filing information now, same charges as complaint.  Atty, waives reading, def stands mute, NG noted.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Kenneth W. Ryder III appeared by video for Thomas Jackson Graves Jr.   Rec'd copy each compl, waives read, waives TL for PH, given TL rts.  May ZOOM & stip to identification.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
